intro: Tristania whiteana, commonly known as the Tristania whiteana, is a flowering plant native to the island of Tristan da Cunha in the South Atlantic Ocean. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in coastal areas with high humidity and salt spray. Due to its limited distribution and fragile habitat, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
